My pleasure
I can answer questions related to NLP
Offering support for common NLP questions
Sentence splitting is splitting texts into sentences
Tokenization is splitting texts into individual words
Stop words recognition is identifying commonly used words (such as 'the', 'a(n)', 'in', etc.) in text, possibly to ignore them in other tasks
Part-of-speech (POS) tagging is identifying the parts of speech of words in context (verbs, nouns, adjectives, etc.)
Morphological analysis is separating words into morphemes and identifying their classes (e.g. tense/aspect of verbs)
Stemming is identifying the stems of words in context by removing inflectional/derivational affixes, such as 'troubl' for 'trouble/troubling/troubled'
Lemmatization is identifying the lemmas (dictionary forms) of words in context, such as 'go' for 'go/goes/going/went'
Word Sense Disambiguation (WSD) is assigning the correct meaning to words in context
Named Entity Recognition (NER) is identifying people, locations, organizations, etc. in text
Constituency/dependency parsing is analyzing the grammatical structure of a sentence
Semantic Role Labeling (SRL) is analyzing the semantic structure of a sentence (who does what to whom, where and when)
Sentiment Analysis is determining whether a text is mostly positive or negative

Word Vectors (or Word Embeddings) and Semantic Similarity is representing the meaning of words as vectors (rows of real valued numbers) where each point captures a dimension of the word's meaning and where semantically similar words have similar vectors (very popular these days)
